metadata.title: College Aid Letter #4
metadata.creator: Federal Security Agency, National Youth Administration for Ohio
correspondents: Presidents of Ohio Colleges and Universities
metadata.description: Letter requesting information for the NYA College and Graduate Aid Program.
metadata.transcript:
Federal Security Agency

NATIONAL YOUTH ADMINISTRATION FOR OHIO

Hoster Bldg-
Columbus, Ohio

November 8, 1939

COLLEGE AID LETTER #4

TO; Presidents of Ohio Colleges and Universities

The Washington office of the National Youth Administration

has requested a report on institution participation in the

NYA College and Graduate Aid Program, including the following information:

1. The institution's total enrollment as of November 1, 1939.
2. The number of Negro students enrolled.
3. The total number of NYA applications received.
4. The number of applications which the institution has approved or is planning to approve for NYA Aid.
5. Institutions which have approved Negro applicants are requested to indicate the type of work to which they have been assigned.

Will you, therefore, kindly furnish us with this information, and as soon as possible, on the enclosed form? We shall appreciate receiving your report before November 17, 1939.

Sincerely yours,

S. Burns Weston
State Administrator

By: [HANDWRITTEN: Harry E. Rabe]
Harry E. Rabe, Assistant Director Work Projects Division
